Spirit trees are a gnomish method of transportation. Limited access to the network is granted upon completion of the Tree Gnome Village quest. You may travel from any spirit tree you have unlocked directly to any other Spirit Tree in the network.

The spirit tree in the centre of Tree Gnome Stronghold is added to the network on completion of The Grand Tree. After that quest, this tree can be used without completion of Tree Gnome Village, however it will only be one way and the other trees will 'not be interested in talking'.

Contents

  • 1 Spirit tree locations
  • 2 Farming
    • 2.1 Payment
    • 2.2 Construction
  • 3 Treasure Trails
  • 4 Dialogue
  • 5 Changes
  • 6 Trivia

Spirit tree locations[edit | edit source]

Permanent locations:

  • Tree Gnome Village in the middle of the Gnome Maze
  • Gnome Stronghold (requires completion of The Grand Tree quest to travel from this location. Before the quest, it can still be used as the destination while travelling from other trees).
  • Battlefield of Khazard - just south of West Ardougne.
  • North-east corner of the Grand Exchange in Varrock.
  • South-west corner of Feldip Hills, next to the Myths' Guild.
  • Prifddinas (requires completion of Song of the Elves quest)

Self-grown spirit tree locations (Farming only):

  • In southeastern Etceteria.
  • Easternmost part of Port Sarim.
  • North-eastern part of Brimhaven, near the Agility Arena.
  • Hosidius, next to the saltpetre deposits and south-east of the Forthos Ruin. Requires 35% Hosidius favour to plant.
  • Inside the advanced tier of the Farming Guild. (Can be accessed before level 85 with the use of stat boosting items, but requires boosting to 85 everytime you wish to teleport there)

Additionally, with 75 Construction:

  • Player-owned house Superior Garden - The crystal saw boost cannot be used, but other boosts are possible. This does not count towards limit on spirit trees planted, and provides only 350 experience in both Farming and Construction.

One of the fastest ways to access a spirit tree is to teleport to the Stronghold Slayer Cave with a slayer ring - the player will arrive close to the tree. If one has an Ardougne cloak, they can teleport to the Ardougne Monastery and use the Khazard Battlefield tree just to the west. The Port Sarim spirit tree patch (83 Farming) is just south of the explorer's ring's (2 or better) cabbage-port. When the player has a Farming cape or a Skills necklace, they can teleport to the Farming Guild and use the spirit tree there.

The fastest way to a spirit tree is having planted one in your player-owned house (75 Construction & 83 Farming) and using a Teleport to house spell or magic tablet.

The fastest way before 83 farming, is teleporting to the Grand Exchange (with a charged ring of wealth or teletab with the medium Varrock Diary completed) and using the spirit tree there.

Farming[edit | edit source]

Main article: Spirit Tree (Farming)

Players can grow their own spirit tree from a spirit sapling made from a spirit seed once they reach level 83 Farming. Since spirit seeds and spirit saplings are untradeable, they can be difficult to obtain. Spirit tree patches can be found in:

  • Etceteria
  • Brimhaven
  • Port Sarim
  • Hosidius
  • Farming Guild - advanced tier

Outside of your POH, you can have one spirit tree from level 83 to level 91, two spirit trees after level 91 and an unlimited amount at level 99. These levels can be boosted.

The growing time for a spirit tree is about 58 hours and 40 minutes. Growing a spirit tree yields 19,501.3 Farming experience, which is the sum of planting (199.5 experience) and checking health (19,301.8 experience).

Spirit trees cannot be cut down, so one simply uses a spade on the tree to remove it. They do not yield roots when removed.

Payment[edit | edit source]

Spirit trees may be tended by gnome gardeners for 5 monkey nuts, 1 monkey bar, and 1 ground suqah tooth. Given the rarity of the seed, the experience given, and the length of time it takes to mature, having a gardener tend the growing plant is strongly recommended.

Construction[edit | edit source]

Players can plant their own spirit tree from a spirit sapling in their Superior Garden at level 75 Construction. Doing so also requires level 83 in Farming. Boosts can be used. This tree does not count towards the number of spirit trees that may be planted at one time. At level 95 Construction players can build a Spiritual Fairy Tree, which grants access to both a spirit tree and a fairy ring.

Treasure Trails[edit | edit source]

  • The Spirit tree in Tree Gnome Village is the solution to the hard cryptic clue: I have many arms but legs, I have just one, I have little family but my seed, You can grow on, I am not dead, yet I am but a spirit, and my power on your quests, you will earn the right to free it. The answer to the challenge scroll is 13112221.

Dialogue[edit | edit source]

This article on an NPC has an associated dialogue page.
Click here for a transcript of possible conversations with this NPC.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
2 September 2020
(update)

Spirit Trees will now give better explanations as to why players are unable to teleport to certain locations.

1 May 2014
(update | poll)

The Spirit tree network has been improved and you no longer need to travel via the Gnome Stronghold or Tree Gnome Village trees to get around.

22 August 2013
(update | poll)

Players can now grow more than one spirit tree at a time. Level 91 Farming will be required for two trees, and level 99 for three.

2 August 2013
(update | poll)

Right-click travel options have been added to spirit trees, as well as Elkoy, Daero, Waydar and Lumdo.

22 February 2013
(update)

This content was included when the Old School RuneScape servers officially launched.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • Previously, the spirit tree in the Tree Gnome Village served as a network hub. All the other trees would only teleport you to the Tree Gnome Village, and then you could use the central tree to teleport to all the others.
  • Spirit tree chatheads (ancient/young) are considerably larger than they appear in the chatbox.

'''Spirit trees''' are a [[Gnome|gnomish]] method of [[transportation]]. Limited access to the network is granted upon completion of the [[Tree Gnome Village]] [[Quests|quest]]. You may travel from any spirit tree you have unlocked '''directly''' to any other Spirit Tree in the network.

The spirit tree in the centre of [[Tree Gnome Stronghold]] is added to the network on completion of [[The Grand Tree]]. After that quest, this tree can be used without completion of Tree Gnome Village, however it will only be one way and the other trees will 'not be interested in talking'.

==Spirit tree locations==
Permanent locations:

*[[Tree Gnome Village (location)|Tree Gnome Village]] in the middle of the [[Gnome Maze]]
*[[Tree Gnome Stronghold|Gnome Stronghold]] (requires completion of [[The Grand Tree]] quest to travel from this location. Before the quest, it can still be used as the destination while travelling from other trees).
*[[Battlefield|Battlefield of Khazard]] - just south of [[West Ardougne]].
*North-east corner of the [[Grand Exchange]] in [[Varrock]].
*South-west corner of [[Feldip Hills]], next to the [[Myths' Guild]].
*[[Prifddinas]] (requires completion of [[Song of the Elves]] quest)

Self-grown spirit tree locations '''([[Farming]] only)''':

*In southeastern [[Etceteria]].
*Easternmost part of [[Port Sarim]].
*North-eastern part of [[Brimhaven]], near the [[Brimhaven Agility Arena|Agility Arena]].
*[[Hosidius]], next to the [[saltpetre]] deposits and south-east of the [[Forthos Ruin]]. Requires 35% Hosidius [[favour]] to plant.
*Inside the advanced tier of the [[Farming Guild]]. (''Can be accessed before level 85 with the use of stat boosting items, but requires boosting to 85 everytime you wish to teleport there'')

Additionally, with 75 [[Construction]]:

*[[Player-owned house]] [[Superior Garden]] - The [[crystal saw]] boost cannot be used, but other [[Farming#Temporary boosts|boosts]] are possible. This does not count towards limit on spirit trees planted, and provides only 350 experience in both Farming and Construction.

One of the fastest ways to access a spirit tree is to teleport to the [[Stronghold Slayer Cave]] with a [[slayer ring]] - the player will arrive close to the tree. If one has an [[Ardougne cloak]], they can [[Teleportation|teleport]] to the [[Ardougne Monastery]] and use the [[Battlefield|Khazard Battlefield]] tree just to the west. The Port Sarim spirit tree patch (83 Farming) is just south of the [[Explorer's ring 2|explorer's ring]]'s (2 or better) cabbage-port. When the player has a [[Farming cape]] or a [[Skills necklace]], they can teleport to the [[Farming Guild]] and use the spirit tree there.

The fastest way to a spirit tree is having planted one in your player-owned house (75 [[Construction]] & 83 Farming) and using a [[Teleport to house]] spell or [[magic tablet]].

The fastest way before 83 farming, is teleporting to the Grand Exchange (with a charged [[ring of wealth]] or teletab with the medium [[Varrock Diary]] completed) and using the spirit tree there.

==Farming==
{{Main|Spirit Tree (Farming)}}
[[File:Spirit tree icon.png|left]]
Players can grow their own spirit tree from a [[spirit sapling]] made from a [[spirit seed]] once they reach level 83 [[Farming]]. Since spirit seeds and spirit saplings are untradeable, they can be difficult to obtain. [[Farming/Patch locations#Spirit tree patches|Spirit tree patches]] can be found in:

*[[Etceteria]]
*[[Brimhaven]]
*[[Port Sarim]]
*[[Hosidius]]
*[[Farming Guild#Advanced tier|Farming Guild - advanced tier]]

Outside of your POH, you can have one spirit tree from level 83 to level 91, two spirit trees after level 91 and an unlimited amount at level 99. These levels can be boosted.

The growing time for a spirit tree is about 58 hours and 40 minutes. Growing a spirit tree yields 19,501.3 Farming [[experience]], which is the sum of planting (199.5 experience) and checking health (19,301.8 experience).

Spirit trees cannot be cut down, so one simply uses a [[spade]] on the tree to remove it. They do not yield roots when removed.

===Payment===
Spirit trees may be tended by [[gnome]] [[Group of Advanced Gardeners|gardeners]] for 5 [[monkey nuts]], 1 [[monkey bar]], and 1 [[Ground tooth|ground suqah tooth]]. Given the rarity of the seed, the [[experience]] given, and the length of time it takes to mature, having a gardener tend the growing plant is strongly recommended.

===Construction===
[[File:Spirit tree (Construction) icon.png|left]]
Players can plant their own [[spirit tree (Construction)|spirit tree]] from a [[spirit sapling]] in their [[Superior Garden]] at level 75 [[Construction]]. Doing so also requires level 83 in [[Farming]]. [[Temporary skill boost|Boosts]] can be used. This tree does not count towards the number of spirit trees that may be planted at one time. At level 95 Construction players can build a [[Spirit tree & fairy ring|Spiritual Fairy Tree]], which grants access to both a spirit tree and a [[Fairy rings|fairy ring]].

==Treasure Trails==
*{{CrypticNPC|The Spirit tree in [[Tree Gnome Village]]|hard|I have many arms but legs, I have just one, I have little family but my seed, You can grow on, I am not dead, yet I am but a spirit, and my power on your quests, you will earn the right to free it.}} The answer to the [[challenge scroll]] is 13112221.

==Trivia==
*Previously, the spirit tree in the [[Tree Gnome Village (location)|Tree Gnome Village]] served as a network hub. All the other trees would only teleport you to the Tree Gnome Village, and then you could use the central tree to teleport to all the others.
*Spirit tree [[chathead]]s ([[:File:Spirit tree (ancient) chathead (full).png|ancient]]/[[:File:Spirit tree (young) chathead (full).png|young]]) are considerably larger than they appear in the chatbox.
